data.title: Small but fun
data.text: This is a one block strip highlighted by neon, restaurants and music.  It is a small town version of what other large cities have, so you only have a one-block trip to visit.  It has a fun feel to it and its nice to be in a pedestrian only area.  Not sure if the music stage in the center is always active - it was the night we were in town.  There were several restaurant choices with varying cuisine and price points, so offers something for everyone.

data.title: One size fits all!
data.text: So many places to eat, drink and be merry.  Expensive.  Walking distance from the Hyatt Regency.  Not for sure about safety.  Didn't see any security but did see many homeless folks.

data.title: Live music, multiple restaurants
data.text: I was expecting and hoping for more to do at 4th Street Live.  They had free live music, which was good.  Variety of restauraunts and a couple bars.

data.title: Free concerts  during convention
data.text:
This is an open street venue, not a restaurant , fun place to hear music and meet friends. Covered street keeps the rain away. 
If you fear crowds, don't go.

data.title: Awesome
data.text: This was a very interesting place and will devotedly visit again if given the chance. I was only in town for a few nights but was able to catch some live music while there.

data.title: This is NOT a restaurant! And you shouldn't have to pay to spend money.
data.text: Trip Advisor and other sites would imply that this is a restaurant. It is not. It is an area of town like Freemont St in Vegas and other towns that have created an area with trendy restaurants, bars, shops, "night life". It's an "experience". One I don't much care to pay $10 for. The title also implies that it is a STREET. Yes, it is, if you want to pay $10 to walk down it. I was walking back to my apartment from a convention at the Galt House. I thought I walk straight down 4th as it would be the quickest and safest route. Nope! The was a rope across the street and a guy was asking for $10. I elected to go a few blocks out of my way to get home (to an apartment I had rented). I stopped and had a drink on 3rd street where I didn't have to pay to walk down the street, just for the drink. They had live music too. I don't like to have to pay to spend money.

data.title: Paying our respects to the champ, Muhammad Ali
data.text:
Lots to do. My husband and I didn't expect Kentucky to have so much to do but it did!

Enjoyed it lots and lots!!!!

data.title: Fun! Lots of fun!
data.text: We were in town for the FSU game and we had a great time.  Lots of fun and interesting things to do here!  Check it out.

data.title: Busy and fun
data.text: 4th Street reminded me of downtown Vegas. Music. Food. Crowd. Fun. It gets pretty crowded and lots of police officers to ensure safety. So many choices of restaurants and bars.

data.title: Busy place on the weekend.
data.text: We were at Guy Fieri's Smokehouse grand opening and realized what a busy place Fourth Street Live is. Generally as locals we shy away from the touristy downtown area. It's sort of how native New Yorkers feel about Times Square. However, with the addition of Guy's new place perhaps there is a reason to go downtown now. By the way, there is a parking garage on Fifth Street that connects to Fourth Street Live. Plus you can find street parking nearby also. After 6 pm and Sunday there is no fee I believe.

data.title: Pub Crawl
data.text: over 10 bars to drink at.  fun at each one. i could do without the $10  per person cover charge - i mean, we bought a lot of drinks as it was about $25-27 for two beers and two cocktails.  live music at some spots, dj's with great music at others.  wish they had outdoor entertainment but they didn't on our visit, but a stage is there so i am sure at some times there is.

data.title: Nightlife
data.text: Fourth Street Live is a great place, has something for everyone's taste. From casual dining to Sports Bar's you can find just about anything. A great place to visit while in Louisville.

data.title: Lots of restaurant and club choices
data.text: Short block of restaurants, clubs and bars just a short walk down from the KICC and the Hyatt. Great variety of places to eat. Good entertainment at night on weekends.

data.title: So much fun!
data.text: I was there on a business trip and we had a great time in the evening walking around and listening to the live music (Old School). The area felt very safe and there were so many cool restaurants, bars, and interesting places to explore. I even tried bourbon for the first time. I wish I had more time to explore because I felt like there were so many more entertaining places to hit. I hope to go back again someday!

data.title: Great Bar Scene
data.text: It has several bars/music venues in one central location. There was a cover charge of $10 to get into the area, not sure if this was because there was a live band playing in the center of it this is all the time. But the $10 proved worth it, because it allowed access to several bars. I really enjoyed The Tavern, which had an area for corn hole, pool, darts, and an arcade. I also enjoyed The  Howler which was a piano bar that was wonderful!

data.title: Jazz Festival 4th of July Weekend
data.text: 4th of July weekend we had a fantastic Jazz weekend at 4th Street Live in Louisville.  This is an area designated for fun! There are restaurants,  bars, clubs, bistros...everything catered toward having fun. The concert was packed with people having fun and dancing to the music. Some of the artist were Jeff Lorber  a jazz key boardest with and extremely talented bamd accompanying him.  Mike Phillips has played with some of the largest names in the business such as Prince and Stevie Wonder. This was truly a fun event.

data.title: live music and great atmosphere
data.text: I attended 4th Street Live for a while. The live music was excellent and the atmosphere was very good.

data.title: Music Lights and  lots of fun
data.text: What a great location to mingle for a few drinks listen to some great music and feel the vibe. Great location and lots of restaurants and bars to choose from. Enjoyed the  jazz festival.

data.title: I'd rather take Fremont Street...
data.text: Undoubtedly, this was done to resemble Fremont Street in Downtown Vegas. But it comes short of it. BTW, it's not a restaurant, it's a street scene. Reading the descriptions on several sites, it sounds interesting and attractive. A visit in person convinced me it was not. There are several places to eat and drink, but that's it. The Jim Beam Bourbon company had in interesting store where you can have a personalized bottle of Bourbon + tastings. There was an empty stage in the middle and a horse carriage offering rides. Whatever you do, do not eat at Eddie Merlot (separate review). Other than this, even the public was not interesting, so not much for people watching.  Skip it.

data.title: Fun! Fun! Fun!
data.text: Definitely hang out here at least one night while you are in town. There are places for everyone. Bourbon bars, Tavern, bands, restaurants. This is where it's happening.
